citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats.
citations.narrative:
On September 8th, 2023, one adult dog “Capt. Ford”, a 3.5-year-old terrier mix, escaped from its primary enclosure just
prior to being loaded onto an aircraft at STL (St Louis Airport). The dog was checked onto Alaska Air flight 549 from St.
Louis, MO (STL) to Seattle, OR (SEA), as baggage but at time of the escape was in possession of G2 Secure Staff. The
dog escaped from its kennel while on a baggage cart onto the ramp.
Transporters and haulers conducting regulated activity must ensure that the primary enclosure containing the animal is
strong enough to securely contain the animal and withstand the rigors of transportation.
The dog was recovered the next morning without further incident and returned to its owner.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.15(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats. 
On September 8th, 2023, one adult dog “Capt. Ford”, a 3.5-year-old terrier mix, escaped from its primary enclosure just 
prior to being loaded onto an aircraft at STL (St Louis Airport). The dog was checked onto Alaska Air flight 549 from St. 
Louis, MO (STL) to Seattle, OR (SEA), as baggage but at time of the escape was in possession of G2 Secure Staff. The 
dog escaped from its kennel while on a baggage cart onto the ramp.  
Transporters and haulers conducting regulated activity must ensure that the primary enclosure containing the animal is 
strong enough to securely contain the animal and withstand the rigors of transportation. 
The dog was recovered the next morning without further incident and returned to its owner. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
